author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sanitary and security workers employed at the District Government Headquarters’ Hospital here staged sit-in dharna on Tuesday, protesting against non-payment of salary for the last two months.

About 90 workers, including 62 women, who were employed by a private agency for sanitary and security services at the hospital, struck work on Tuesday morning after they failed to receive salaries.

The private agency had promised to credit their salaries for the months of January and February on Tuesday but failed to do so, they said. After the representatives of the agency and Hospital Superintendent held talks with them and assured them that salaries would be credited into their accounts by evening, they withdrew the stir.

However, the salaries were not credited into their accounts till late on Tuesday evening, Sanjay Babu, one of the workers who led the protest, said. They again spoke to them and assured the protesters that they would receive their salaries by Wednesday noon, he said.

They resumed work immediately after the agency and hospital authorities gave them assurance, he said adding they would decide the further course of action after waiting for a day on Wednesday. The agency paid monthly salary of about Rs. 9,000 to Rs. 10,000 to a worker, he said.

Though the agency deducted about Rs. 1,000 towards insurance and Provident Fund from each worker’s salary there were no proper records to prove the genuineness, he said.
title: Sanitary and security workers at GH stage sit-in dharna
